question.title: Set dynamic version inside the parent tag in spring boot
question.body:
I have been doing a micro service project, here i have one parent pom and 17 child pom i want to set a dynamic value to all version tag inside the parent tag.

parent.pom

<groupId>com.hello.services</groupId>
<artifactId>hello-parent</artifactId>
<version>${project.build.version}</version>
<packaging>pom</packaging>
<name>hello-parent</name>

<properties>
    <project.build.version>1.0.0</project.build.version>
</properties>

child.pom

  <parent>
    <groupId>com.hello.services</groupId>
    <artifactId>hello-parent</artifactId>
    <version>${project.build.version}</version>
    <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
  </parent>

The problem is Maven resolves the parent before it knows what ${project.build.version} means â€” and there's no way to defer that resolution or tell Maven to get the version from a property at that stage.

Can I define dynamic version?

answers.body:
You need to call the property ${revision}. There are certain reserved properties for this.

See also:

https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-maven-ci-friendly.html
